pullRequest.title: [avmfritz] Refactoring of discovery service and internal event handling
pullRequest.bodyText:
Refactoring of discovery service and internal event handling

The main purpose of this PR was to remove a superfluous polling job for background discovery as the same request was done all the time to update the channels / properties of ThingHandlers.
Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp github@christophweitkamp.de

nodes.bodyText: device.isSwitchableOutlet seems redundant when device.getSwitch() could be made to return false if it wasn't a switchable outlet.

It might be better to adjust the logic so you only need to check device instanceof DeviceModel and cast to DeviceModel only once. But it might also make the logic less readable so I'm fine if you don't want to change it.
device.getHkr() should probably be cached to a local variable
((GroupModel) device).getGroupinfo() should be cached to a local variable
If onDeviceRemove/onDeviceGone cause the thing to go offline, wouldn't adding the device make the thing go online?
This logic is also used in AVMFritzBaseThingHandler so it should be refactored into a utility class.
Is there no constant in the core for this channel type?
